definitions.definition: admit (an event or activity) as legal or acceptable.
examples: a plan to allow Sunday shopping
the dissident was allowed to leave the country
synonyms: give the green light to/for; formalaccede to "we don't allow open fires at this campground"

examples: he was allowed his first sip of Scotch and soda

definitions.definition: permit (someone) to enter a place or go in a particular direction.
examples: the river was patrolled and few people were allowed across

definitions.definition: give the necessary time or opportunity for.
examples: they agreed to a ceasefire to allow talks with the government

definitions.definition: make provision or provide scope for (something).
examples: the house was demolished to allow for road widening

definitions.definition: take (something) into consideration when making plans or calculations.
examples: income rose by 11 percent allowing for inflation

definitions.definition: provide or set aside (a specified amount of something) for a specific purpose.
examples: allow an hour or so for driving
synonyms: leave "allow an hour or so for driving"

examples: he allowed that the penalty appeared too harsh for the crime
synonyms: grant "she allowed that all people had their funny little ways"

examples: Lincoln allowed that he himself could never support the man
